items.sentence: I\'d like for Tom to tell you what he did on Friday night.
I\'d like for Tom to tell you where he was two nights ago.
Roads in the country aren\'t as busy as those in the city.
Tom went out of his way to make sure Mary had a good time.
I wake up at six, but I don\'t get out of bed until seven.
I wish that I could\'ve eaten at that restaurant with you.
My house isn\'t very large, but it\'s large enough for me.
Tom gave the man who came to the door both food and money.
Please continue with your story. It\'s really interesting.
I forgot to turn off the television before going to sleep.
Tom can swim a lot better than I thought he\'d be able to.
Tom doesn\'t understand why Mary behaves the way she does.
There\'s a possibility Tom won\'t go to Australia with us.
I\'d like to thank you for everything you\'ve done for me.
You\'re the only Canadian I know that doesn\'t like bacon.
You\'re the only one who knows how to get to Tom\'s house.
Why in the world are you doing that at this time of night?
Tom doesn\'t have a very good Japanese-English dictionary.
If you want to make your dreams come true, keep on trying.
Tom helps Mary because he wants to, not because he has to.
